channel.title: GPU on head spin - the Heads or Tails blog
channel.description: Recent content in GPU on head spin - the Heads or Tails blog

item.title: Colab Pro+ Features, Kaggling on Colab, and Cloud GPU Platforms
item.description: In the final, hectic days of a recent Kaggle competition I found myself in want of more GPU power. As one often does in such an occasion. My own laptop, with its GPU setup, was doing a fine job with various small models and small images, but scaling up both aspects became necessary to climb the leaderboard further. My first choice options GCP and AWS quickly turned out to require quota increases which either didn’t happen or took too long.

item.title: Installing CUDA, tensorflow, torch for R & Python on Ubuntu 20.04
item.description: Last weekend, I finally managed to get round to upgrading Ubuntu from version 19.10 to the long-term support release 20.04 on my workhorse laptop. To be precise, I’m using the Kubuntu flavour since I’m more of a KDE guy myself. I usually do a fresh install on those occasions, instead of a dist_upgrade, because it’s a good opportunity to remove clutter and update software that I might otherwise just keep at an older version, out of convenience.
